protocols.name: Model Context Protocol
protocols.description: Standardized protocol for connecting AI models to external tools and data sources
protocols.fullDescription: The Model Context Protocol (MCP) is an open protocol that standardizes how applications provide context to LLMs. Created by Anthropic, MCP enables AI systems to securely connect to data sources, tools, and services through a unified interface.
useCases: Connecting agents to enterprise data sources

protocols.name: Agent-to-Agent Protocol
protocols.description: Protocol for direct agent-to-agent communication and collaboration
protocols.fullDescription: A2A enables autonomous agents to discover, authenticate, and communicate with each other. It provides standardized message formats, capability negotiation, and trust frameworks for multi-agent systems.

protocols.name: REST API
protocols.description: Representational State Transfer architecture for web services
protocols.fullDescription: REST is an architectural style for distributed systems, using standard HTTP methods (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE) to interact with resources. It's the most widely adopted API pattern for agent integration.

protocols.name: GraphQL
protocols.description: Query language for APIs with a type system for data
protocols.fullDescription: GraphQL is a query language and runtime for APIs that allows clients to request exactly the data they need. It provides strong typing, introspection, and efficient data fetching for agent systems.

protocols.name: WebSocket
protocols.description: Full-duplex communication protocol for real-time agent interactions
protocols.fullDescription: WebSocket provides persistent, bidirectional communication channels over a single TCP connection. Ideal for real-time agent communication, streaming responses, and live updates.

protocols.name: gRPC
protocols.description: High-performance RPC framework using Protocol Buffers
protocols.fullDescription: gRPC is a modern, high-performance RPC framework that uses HTTP/2 for transport and Protocol Buffers for serialization. It provides strong typing, efficient binary serialization, and built-in streaming.

protocols.name: MQTT
protocols.description: Lightweight publish-subscribe messaging protocol for IoT and agents
protocols.fullDescription: MQTT is a lightweight, publish-subscribe network protocol optimized for constrained devices and low-bandwidth networks. Perfect for IoT agent integration and distributed agent systems.

protocols.name: JSON-RPC
protocols.description: Lightweight remote procedure call protocol using JSON
protocols.fullDescription: JSON-RPC is a stateless, lightweight RPC protocol using JSON for data encoding. It's simple, language-agnostic, and widely supported for agent tool integration.

protocols.name: Server-Sent Events
protocols.description: Server-to-client streaming protocol for real-time updates
protocols.fullDescription: Server-Sent Events (SSE) provides a simple, HTTP-based protocol for servers to push real-time updates to clients. Ideal for streaming LLM responses and agent status updates.

protocols.name: OpenAPI
protocols.description: Specification for describing and documenting REST APIs
protocols.fullDescription: OpenAPI (formerly Swagger) is a specification for machine-readable API descriptions. It enables automatic discovery, code generation, and validation for agent-API integration.
protocols.codeExample:
// OpenAPI Specification Example
openapi: 3.0.0
info:
  title: Agent API
  version: 1.0.0
paths:
  /tasks:
    post:
      summary: Create a new task
      requestBody:
        content:
          application/json:
            schema:
              type: object
              properties:
                action:
                  type: string
                params:
                  type: object

protocols.name: ActivityPub
protocols.description: Decentralized social networking protocol for agent federation
protocols.fullDescription: ActivityPub is a W3C standard for decentralized social networking. It enables agents to publish activities, discover other agents, and participate in federated networks.

protocols.name: x402 Protocol
protocols.fullDescription: x402 extends HTTP 402 (Payment Required) with standardized micropayment flows for agent services. It enables agents to monetize capabilities and pay for services autonomously.

categories.name: Discovery
categories.description: Protocols for finding and understanding agent capabilities

categories.name: Execution
categories.description: Protocols for executing agent tasks and tool calls

categories.name: Data
categories.description: Protocols for querying and exchanging structured data
